import React, { Component } from 'react'; import './sdg14.css'; import '../../node_modules/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css'; class Sdg14 extends Component { render() { return (

Goal 14-Life below land

To enhance the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources by implementing international laws as reflected in UNCLOS(United Nations Convention for the Law Of the Sea), which provides the legal framework for the conservation and sustainable use of oceans and their resources.

To provide access for small-scale artisanal fishers to marine resources and marine markets.

To conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information by 2020.

Minimize and address the impacts of ocean acidification, including through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels.

To sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take necessary actions for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans by 2020.

Preventing and significantly reducing marine pollution of all kinds, in particular from land-based activities, including marine debris and nutrient pollution by 2025.

To address and minimize the impacts of ocean acidification, through enhanced scientific cooperation at all levels.

To effectively regulate harvesting and end overfishing, illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing, destructive fishing practices and implement science-based management plans, in order to restore fish stocks in the shortest time feasible, at least to the levels that can produce maximum sustainable yield as determined by their biological characteristics by 2020.

Conserving at least 10 per cent of the coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information by 2020.

Increasing the economic benefits to small Island developing states and least developed countries from the sustainable use of marine resources, including through sustainable management of fisheries, aquaculture and tourism by 2030.

Increasing scientific knowledge, develop research capacity and transfer marine technology, taking into account the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission Criteria and Guidelines on the Transfer of Marine Technology, in order to improve ocean health and to enhance the contribution of marine biodiversity to the development of developing countries, in particular small island developing states and least developed countries.

 ); } } export default Sdg14;
